segment.source: Streaming Media Performance
segment.target: Streaming Media Performance

segment.source: Streaming Media Performance
segment.target: Streaming Media Performance

segment.source: Streaming Media Performance
segment.target: Streaming Media Performance

segment.source: The Streaming Media Performance assessment helps you assess the performance of a particular computer configuration when you stream media using Internet Explorer.
segment.target: The Streaming Media Performance assessment helps you assess the performance of a particular computer configuration when you stream media using Internet Explorer.

segment.source: You can use the assessment results to understand, compare, and improve the streaming media experience.
segment.target: You can use the assessment results to understand, compare, and improve the streaming media experience.

segment.source: The Streaming Media Performance assessment uses a streaming server application that is deployed either on a local computer or on a remote server.
segment.target: The Streaming Media Performance assessment uses a streaming server application that is deployed either on a local computer or on a remote server.

segment.source: The assessment starts Internet Explorer and plays back the media content from start to finish or to a specified time.
segment.target: The assessment starts Internet Explorer and plays back the media content from start to finish or to a specified time.

segment.source: Then, Internet Explorer closes and results are generated.
segment.target: Then, Internet Explorer closes and results are generated.

segment.source: The following graphic illustrates the assessment process.
segment.target: The following graphic illustrates the assessment process.

segment.source: workflow graphic for streaming media
segment.target: workflow graphic for streaming media

segment.source: The focus of the assessment is on video playback using Internet Explorer.
segment.target: The focus of the assessment is on video playback using Internet Explorer.

segment.source: The assessment mimics a user who is watching a movie and reports any glitches that it detects.
segment.target: The assessment mimics a user who is watching a movie and reports any glitches that it detects.

segment.source: The assessment plays video content from several workloads that range from low resolution to high resolution.
segment.target: The assessment plays video content from several workloads that range from low resolution to high resolution.

segment.source: When it is run on a single computer, the process uses HTML 5.0 pages that are available in the Content path folder.
segment.target: When it is run on a single computer, the process uses HTML 5.0 pages that are available in the Content path folder.

segment.source: These files contain embedded media such as the 360p.html, 480p.html, 720p.html, and 1080p.html files.
segment.target: These files contain embedded media such as the 360p.html, 480p.html, 720p.html, and 1080p.html files.

segment.source: Each video workload plays for one minute.
segment.target: Each video workload plays for one minute.

segment.source: A glitch is any detectable visual or auditory defect in the user experience.
segment.target: A glitch is any detectable visual or auditory defect in the user experience.

segment.source: The assessment provides test results for video glitches.
segment.target: The assessment provides test results for video glitches.

segment.source: It reports glitches for one-second intervals throughout the running of the video content.
segment.target: It reports glitches for one-second intervals throughout the running of the video content.

segment.source: The video glitches are categorized as minor, medium, and major.
segment.target: The video glitches are categorized as minor, medium, and major.

segment.source: The assessment also reports the placement of the glitches.
segment.target: The assessment also reports the placement of the glitches.

segment.source: Viewers are likely to notice when three or more consecutive frames are dropped.
segment.target: Viewers are likely to notice when three or more consecutive frames are dropped.

segment.source: Additionally, although the audio stream is less likely to be interrupted than the video stream, a series of consecutive dropped video frames affect the viewer experience because the audio track is briefly not synchronized with the video track.
segment.target: Additionally, although the audio stream is less likely to be interrupted than the video stream, a series of consecutive dropped video frames affect the viewer experience because the audio track is briefly not synchronized with the video track.

segment.source: For more information about the results and issues produced by this assessment, see Results for the Streaming Media Performance Assessment.
segment.target: For more information about the results and issues produced by this assessment, see Results for the Streaming Media Performance Assessment.

segment.source: Warning
segment.target: Warning

segment.source: Note that when the Streaming Media Assessment is configured to stream to the same device that is playing back the video (default settings), there may be audio or video glitches that are not actionable.
segment.target: Note that when the Streaming Media Assessment is configured to stream to the same device that is playing back the video (default settings), there may be audio or video glitches that are not actionable.

segment.source: The ideal scenario to test streaming media is to set up a remote server described here: Streaming media assessment: set up a remote server.
segment.target: The ideal scenario to test streaming media is to set up a remote server described here: Streaming media assessment: set up a remote server.

segment.source: In this topic:
segment.target: In this topic:

segment.source: Before You Begin
segment.target: Before You Begin

segment.source: Workloads
segment.target: Workloads

segment.source: Settings
segment.target: Settings

segment.source: Before You Begin
segment.target: Before You Begin

segment.source: The first-run help tips in Windows 8.1 can negatively affect assessment results.
segment.target: The first-run help tips in Windows 8.1 can negatively affect assessment results.

segment.source: To disable these, run the following command from an elevated command prompt, and reboot the computer:
segment.target: To disable these, run the following command from an elevated command prompt, and reboot the computer:

segment.source: When running this assessment on Windows 8.1, make sure the Collect Analysis Trace setting is unchecked when assessing expected battery life.
segment.target: When running this assessment on Windows 8.1, make sure the Collect Analysis Trace setting is unchecked when assessing expected battery life.

segment.source: When checked, this option will produce an incorrect estimation.
segment.target: When checked, this option will produce an incorrect estimation.

segment.source: Enable analysis trace collection only when you need additional information to investigate other energy-related problems.
segment.target: Enable analysis trace collection only when you need additional information to investigate other energy-related problems.

segment.source: To prepare to run the assessment, follow these steps:
segment.target: To prepare to run the assessment, follow these steps:

segment.source: Exit any open applications.
segment.target: Exit any open applications.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Do not touch the mouse or keyboard after the assessment job starts.
segment.target: Do not touch the mouse or keyboard after the assessment job starts.

segment.source: Running other applications or jobs at the same time as the assessment job can affect your results.
segment.target: Running other applications or jobs at the same time as the assessment job can affect your results.

segment.source: Also, the Streaming Media Performance assessment does not include any measurement of seeking or pausing functionality.
segment.target: Also, the Streaming Media Performance assessment does not include any measurement of seeking or pausing functionality.

segment.source: Do not seek or pause the video during the assessment.
segment.target: Do not seek or pause the video during the assessment.

segment.source: Complete the appropriate steps to set up the assessment job on a single computer or on two computers that are connected over a network, as shown in the following table.
segment.target: Complete the appropriate steps to set up the assessment job on a single computer or on two computers that are connected over a network, as shown in the following table.

segment.source: Job type
segment.target: Job type

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Run the job on a single computer
segment.target: Run the job on a single computer

segment.source: To run the job on a single computer, install the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK) Technical Reference and open Windows Assessment Console.
segment.target: To run the job on a single computer, install the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK) Technical Reference and open Windows Assessment Console.

segment.source: Then, follow the instructions that are provided in the introduction to run the Streaming Media Performance assessment.
segment.target: Then, follow the instructions that are provided in the introduction to run the Streaming Media Performance assessment.

segment.source: The job runs automatically in Internet Explorer 10 or later versions.
segment.target: The job runs automatically in Internet Explorer 10 or later versions.

segment.source: The job runs in the Internet Explorer Media pipeline in full-screen mode.
segment.target: The job runs in the Internet Explorer Media pipeline in full-screen mode.

segment.source: We do not recommend user interaction.
segment.target: We do not recommend user interaction.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: By default, a 1080p, 30-fps video is available to the job.
segment.target: By default, a 1080p, 30-fps video is available to the job.

segment.source: The assessment plays on the full computer screen.
segment.target: The assessment plays on the full computer screen.

segment.source: Additional workloads include 360p at 30 fps, 480p at 30 fps, and 720p at 30 fps.
segment.target: Additional workloads include 360p at 30 fps, 480p at 30 fps, and 720p at 30 fps.

segment.source: When the job runs on a single computer, the job results include the number of video or audio glitches that occur.
segment.target: When the job runs on a single computer, the job results include the number of video or audio glitches that occur.

segment.source: Run the job on two computers
segment.target: Run the job on two computers

segment.source: To run the job on two networked computers, install the Windows ADK Technical Reference on both computers, open Windows Assessment Console, select the Streaming Media Performance assessment, and then configure the settings as shown in Settings.
segment.target: To run the job on two networked computers, install the Windows ADK Technical Reference on both computers, open Windows Assessment Console, select the Streaming Media Performance assessment, and then configure the settings as shown in Settings.

segment.source: The local computer streams content from the HTTP streaming server application that is installed on the second or remote computer.
segment.target: The local computer streams content from the HTTP streaming server application that is installed on the second or remote computer.

segment.source: Before the assessment starts, the Streaming Media Performance assessment runs some pre-checks on the system.
segment.target: Before the assessment starts, the Streaming Media Performance assessment runs some pre-checks on the system.

segment.source: When these pre-checks fail, the assessment will generate errors and warnings.
segment.target: When these pre-checks fail, the assessment will generate errors and warnings.

segment.source: Although errors block the assessment from running, warnings do not block the assessment from running.
segment.target: Although errors block the assessment from running, warnings do not block the assessment from running.

segment.source: You can make the adjustments that are recommended in the warning message, and continue to run the job.
segment.target: You can make the adjustments that are recommended in the warning message, and continue to run the job.

segment.source: Unaddressed warnings and errors are reported in the results.
segment.target: Unaddressed warnings and errors are reported in the results.

segment.source: For more information about the results and issues produced by this assessment, see Results for the Streaming Media Performance Assessment.
segment.target: For more information about the results and issues produced by this assessment, see Results for the Streaming Media Performance Assessment.

segment.source: System Requirements
segment.target: System Requirements

segment.source: You can run this assessment only on a computer that is running Windows 8 and Internet Explorer 10.
segment.target: You can run this assessment only on a computer that is running Windows 8 and Internet Explorer 10.

segment.source: Supported architectures include x86-based, x64-based systems, and ARM-based systems.
segment.target: Supported architectures include x86-based, x64-based systems, and ARM-based systems.

segment.source: There are two ways to run this assessment on Windows RT:
segment.target: There are two ways to run this assessment on Windows RT:

segment.source: Package the assessment job in the Windows Assessment Console (WAC) and then run it on Windows RT.
segment.target: Package the assessment job in the Windows Assessment Console (WAC) and then run it on Windows RT.

segment.source: For more information, see Package a job and run it on another computer.
segment.target: For more information, see Package a job and run it on another computer.

segment.source: Use Windows Assessment Services to run assessments on Windows RT.
segment.target: Use Windows Assessment Services to run assessments on Windows RT.

segment.source: For more information, see Windows Assessment Services.
segment.target: For more information, see Windows Assessment Services.

segment.source: Workloads
segment.target: Workloads

segment.source: A workload is a set of automated tasks that simulate user activity in a predefined, repeatable manner.
segment.target: A workload is a set of automated tasks that simulate user activity in a predefined, repeatable manner.

segment.source: The workloads run independent of each other.
segment.target: The workloads run independent of each other.

segment.source: The assessment plays video content from several workloads that range from low resolution to high resolution.
segment.target: The assessment plays video content from several workloads that range from low resolution to high resolution.

segment.source: You can select any combination of these workloads to run during the assessment.
segment.target: You can select any combination of these workloads to run during the assessment.

segment.source: 360p (30 FPS) Workload
segment.target: 360p (30 FPS) Workload

segment.source: 480p (30 FPS) Workload
segment.target: 480p (30 FPS) Workload

segment.source: 720p (30 FPS) Workload
segment.target: 720p (30 FPS) Workload

segment.source: 1080p (30 FPS) Workload
segment.target: 1080p (30 FPS) Workload

segment.source: The “p” in the video resolution indicates Progressive scan, which is used in computer monitors and digital televisions.
segment.target: The “p” in the video resolution indicates Progressive scan, which is used in computer monitors and digital televisions.

segment.source: An “i” in video resolution indicates Interlaced scan, used in standard television formats.
segment.target: An “i” in video resolution indicates Interlaced scan, used in standard television formats.

segment.source: Interlaced video content is not used in this assessment.
segment.target: Interlaced video content is not used in this assessment.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can also use the Streaming Media assessment as a workload in an energy-efficiency job.
segment.target: You can also use the Streaming Media assessment as a workload in an energy-efficiency job.

segment.source: For more information about energy-efficiency jobs, see Connected Standby Energy Efficiency and Create and run an energy efficiency job.
segment.target: For more information about energy-efficiency jobs, see Connected Standby Energy Efficiency and Create and run an energy efficiency job.

segment.source: Settings
segment.target: Settings

segment.source: By default, this assessment uses the recommended settings.
segment.target: By default, this assessment uses the recommended settings.

segment.source: These settings are defined by Microsoft to ensure that the results can be compared across different computer configurations or over time on the same computer.
segment.target: These settings are defined by Microsoft to ensure that the results can be compared across different computer configurations or over time on the same computer.

segment.source: When you review the results, the run information includes metadata that indicates that the recommended settings were used so that you can easily identify results that use recommended settings in addition to those that don’t.
segment.target: When you review the results, the run information includes metadata that indicates that the recommended settings were used so that you can easily identify results that use recommended settings in addition to those that don’t.

segment.source: You can also customize these settings if you want to gather different data than what is captured by default.
segment.target: You can also customize these settings if you want to gather different data than what is captured by default.

segment.source: For example, you might identify specific data that would help you do a more detailed analysis of a particular aspect of the computer.
segment.target: For example, you might identify specific data that would help you do a more detailed analysis of a particular aspect of the computer.

segment.source: The following table describes the assessment settings, recommended setting values, and alternative values for each setting.
segment.target: The following table describes the assessment settings, recommended setting values, and alternative values for each setting.

segment.source: Setting
segment.target: Setting

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Use recommended settings
segment.target: Use recommended settings

segment.source: Specifies whether the assessment uses the recommended settings.
segment.target: Specifies whether the assessment uses the recommended settings.

segment.source: By default, this check box is selected.
segment.target: By default, this check box is selected.

segment.source: To change the settings for this assessment, you must first clear this check box.
segment.target: To change the settings for this assessment, you must first clear this check box.

segment.source: Iterations
segment.target: Iterations

segment.source: Specifies the number of times that the assessment runs.
segment.target: Specifies the number of times that the assessment runs.

segment.source: By default, the value is 3.
segment.target: By default, the value is 3.

segment.source: You will see the video play 5 times during 3 iterations.
segment.target: You will see the video play 5 times during 3 iterations.

segment.source: The first is a 15 second to initialize Internet Explorer, 3 video playbacks are for calculating the metrics and one is for assessing the results.
segment.target: The first is a 15 second to initialize Internet Explorer, 3 video playbacks are for calculating the metrics and one is for assessing the results.

segment.source: Content Path
segment.target: Content Path

segment.source: Specifies the path of the source directory for the workload dataset that contains media and HTML files that the assessment uses.
segment.target: Specifies the path of the source directory for the workload dataset that contains media and HTML files that the assessment uses.

segment.source: By default, the content is picked up from .
segment.target: By default, the content is picked up from .

segment.source: You can specify you own value.
segment.target: You can specify you own value.

segment.source: Server Name
segment.target: Server Name

segment.source: Specifies the name of the server on the local network.
segment.target: Specifies the name of the server on the local network.

segment.source: Even though the box appears to be blank, the path of the default server is defined.
segment.target: Even though the box appears to be blank, the path of the default server is defined.

segment.source: If the setting is not specified, the assessment will start the streaming server on the local computer.
segment.target: If the setting is not specified, the assessment will start the streaming server on the local computer.

segment.source: Port
segment.target: Port

segment.source: Specifies the port on which the server accepts requests.
segment.target: Specifies the port on which the server accepts requests.

segment.source: By default, the port on which the server accepts requests is defined as 80.
segment.target: By default, the port on which the server accepts requests is defined as 80.

segment.source: You can also specify your own value.
segment.target: You can also specify your own value.

segment.source: Streaming Time
segment.target: Streaming Time

segment.source: Specifies the maximum time, in seconds, that the assessment waits for a video workload to finish playing.
segment.target: Specifies the maximum time, in seconds, that the assessment waits for a video workload to finish playing.

segment.source: By default, the value for this setting is 65.
segment.target: By default, the value for this setting is 65.

segment.source: You can also specify your own value.
segment.target: You can also specify your own value.

segment.source: ETW Trace File Name
segment.target: ETW Trace File Name

segment.source: Specifies the name of the trace file that collects the Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) events that the assessment generates.
segment.target: Specifies the name of the trace file that collects the Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) events that the assessment generates.

segment.source: Even though the box appears to be blank, the trace file for collecting events is defined.
segment.target: Even though the box appears to be blank, the trace file for collecting events is defined.

segment.source: You can also specify your own value.
segment.target: You can also specify your own value.

segment.source: Disable ETW Tracing
segment.target: Disable ETW Tracing

segment.source: Disables ETW tracing.
segment.target: Disables ETW tracing.

segment.source: By default, this check box is cleared.
segment.target: By default, this check box is cleared.

segment.source: If this check box is selected, ETW tracing is disabled and the assessment job does not generate an ETW trace file.
segment.target: If this check box is selected, ETW tracing is disabled and the assessment job does not generate an ETW trace file.

segment.target: Related topics
